revision.comment: Undid revision 960690434 by [[Special:Contributions/82.132.217.102|82.132.217.102]] ([[User talk:82.132.217.102|talk]]) "The music is as studiously funk-soul as ever"
revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox album | name = Man of the Woods | type = studio | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | cover = Justin Timberlake - Man of the Woods (Official Album Cover).png | border = yes | alt = The cover image features two images of a male, edited to appear as one. Top-diagonal-half image features male in all-black suit and white undershirt, in a snow-covered wooded area. Bottom-diagonal-half image features male in ripped blue jeans, flannel button down shirt in a smog-filled wooded area. Below this title: MAN OF THE WOODS, appears in capitalised handwritten print. | released = {{start date|2018|2|2}} | recorded = 2016–2017 | studio = {{hlist|[[Conway Recording Studios]], [[Los Angeles]]|[[EastWest Studios]], Los Angeles|[[Jungle City Studios]], [[New York City]]|[[Red Bull Music Academy|Red Bull Studios]], [[Sao Paulo]]}} | genre = {{hlist|[[Pop music|Pop]]|[[Contemporary R&B|R&B]]|[[Electronic music|electronic]]<ref name="genres"/>|[[funk]]|[[Soul music|soul]]<ref name="variety"/>}} | length = {{duration|m=65|s=54}} | label = [[RCA Records|RCA]] | producer = {{hlist|Justin Timberlake (also [[Executive producer#Music|exec.]])|[[Danja (producer)|Danja]]|[[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]]|[[Jerome "J-Roc" Harmon]]|[[Eric Hudson]]|Elliott Ives|[[Rob Knox (producer)|Rob Knox]]|[[The Neptunes]]|[[Timbaland]]}} | prev_title = [[The 20/20 Experience – 2 of 2]] | prev_year = 2013 | year = 2018 | next_title = | next_year = | misc = {{Singles | name = Man of the Woods | type = studio | single1 = [[Filthy (song)|Filthy]] | single1date = January 5, 2018 | single2 = [[Supplies (song)|Supplies]] | single2date = January 18, 2018 | single3 = [[Say Something (Justin Timberlake song)|Say Something]] | single3date = January 25, 2018 <!-- Sorry, but an album cover is not a [[Wikipedia:RS|reliable source]] that dictates when singles are coming out. Please find a [[Wikipedia:Verifiability|verifiable]] third-party source to prove that "Man of the Woods" is the fourth single. --> }} }} '''''Man of the Woods''''' is the fifth studio album by American singer-songwriter [[Justin Timberlake]]. It was released on February 2, 2018.<ref name="release">{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/justin-timberlake-announces-new-album-man-of-the-woods-single-coming-friday-watch-1202650769/|title=Justin Timberlake Announces New Album ‘Man of the Woods’|date=January 2, 2018|work=Variety|access-date=January 2, 2018|first=Jem|last=Aswad}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8085797/justin-timberlake-new-album-man-of-the-woods-release-date-video|title=Justin Timberlake Announces New Album 'Man of the Woods,' Reveals Release Date|date=January 2, 2018|access-date=January 2, 2018|work=Billboard|first=Taylor|last=Weatherby}}</ref> The production of the album was handled by Timberlake, [[The Neptunes]], [[Timbaland]], [[Danja (record producer)|Danja]], [[Jerome Harmon|J-Roc]], [[Eric Hudson]], and [[Rob Knox (producer)|Rob Knox]]. The album sees Timberlake experimenting with elements of [[contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[funk]], [[pop music|pop]], [[soul music|soul]], and [[Americana (music)|Americana]].<ref name="The Independent"/> The album is named after his son Silas, whose name means "Man of the forest".<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.straitstimes.com/lifestyle/entertainment/still-sexy-but-now-fatherly-justin-timberlake-returns |title=Still sexy but now fatherly, Justin Timberlake returns |date=February 1, 2018 |work=[[The Straits Times]]}}</ref> The album's first single "[[Filthy (song)|Filthy]]" was released on January 5, 2018, followed by "[[Supplies (song)|Supplies]]" and "[[Say Something (Justin Timberlake song)|Say Something]]" on January 19 and 26, respectively. The album track "[[Man of the Woods (song)|Man of the Woods]]" was also accompanied by a music video.
The album debuted atop the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], while [[Filthy (song)|"Filthy"]] and [[Say Something (Justin Timberlake song)|"Say Something"]] reached the top 10 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. To promote the album, Timberlake embarked on his sixth concert tour, [[The Man of the Woods Tour]] in March 2018. The single "Say Something" received a nomination for [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Duo/Group Performance|Best Pop Duo/Group Performance]] at the [[61st Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/news/2019-grammy-awards-complete-nominations-list |title=2019 GRAMMY Awards: Complete Nominations List |date=December 7, 2018 |work=[[The Recording Academy]] |accessdate=December 7, 2018}}</ref>
==Background== After completing the successful [[The 20/20 Experience World Tour|world tour]] for his previous records ''[[The 20/20 Experience]]'' and ''[[The 20/20 Experience – 2 of 2]]'', Timberlake took a one-year break and later returned to produce [[Trolls (soundtrack)|the soundtrack]] for the animated film ''[[Trolls (film)|Trolls]]'' in 2016. In a radio interview in May 2016 Timberlake first confirmed working on a new album but without a date set for release yet, "I think where I grew up in America has a lot of influence – Growing up in [[Tennessee]] – very central of the country – [[Memphis, Tennessee|Memphis]] is known as the birthplace of rock & roll, but also the home of the blues, but [[Nashville]]'s right down the street so there's a lot of country music."<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/justin-timberlake-im-definitely-working-on-a-new-album-20160506 | title=Justin Timberlake: 'I'm Definitely Working on a New Album' | work=Rolling Stone | date=May 6, 2016 | accessdate=May 7, 2016 | author=Spanos, Brittany}}</ref> Timberlake worked with producers [[Timbaland]], [[Danja (record producer)|Danja]], [[The Neptunes]], and [[Max Martin]],<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.idolator.com/7648496/justin-timberlake-album-pharrell-timbaland-max-martin | title=Justin Timberlake Says He's Been in the Studio With Pharrell, Timbaland and Max Martin | work=Idolator|first=Rachel|last=Sonis | date=October 17, 2016 | accessdate=October 18, 2016}}</ref> and in following interviews he stated, "It sounds more like where I've come from than any other music I've ever made... It's Southern American music. But I want to make it sound modern – at least that's the idea right now."<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/features/justin-timberlake-jimmy-fallon-fatherhood-his-uncertain-future-972807 |title=Justin Timberlake on Fatherhood, His Uncertain Future and Being Best Friends With Jimmy Fallon |date=February 8, 2017 |access-date=February 8, 2017 |last=Svetkey |first=Benjamin |work=The Hollywood Reporter}}</ref> In December 2017, Timberlake's website displayed the logo featuring the letters "MOTW".<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.rap-up.com/2017/12/30/justin-timberlake-teases-new-music-man-of-the-woods-motw/ |title=Justin Timberlake Teases New Music With Mysterious "MOTW" Logo |date=December 30, 2017 |work=Rap-Up |access-date=January 2, 2018}}</ref> ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' physical magazine reported that the album would feature a collaboration with singer-songwriter [[Chris Stapleton]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://hiphop-n-more.com/2017/12/justin-timberlake-teases-man-of-the-woods-on-new-website/ |title=Justin Timberlake's Teases Man of the Woods on New Website |date=December 30, 2017 |work=Hip-Hop N More |access-date=January 2, 2018}}</ref> Stapleton and Timberlake previously collaborated in a live performance at the [[49th Annual Country Music Association Awards|2015 CMA Awards]], with some music publications speculating his next record may be influenced by [[Music of Tennessee|Southern music]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2015/11/18/justin-timberlake-country-album-timbaland/76000238/ |title=Justin Timberlake may go country on his next album, says Timbaland |last=McDermott |first=Maeve |date=November 18, 2015 |work=USA Today |access-date=January 2, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1760466/yall-ready-for-a-country-justin-timberlake/ |title=Ready for a Country Justin Timberlake? |last=Bonaguro |first=Allison |date=November 18, 2015 |work=CMT |access-date=January 2, 2018}}</ref>
==Release and promotion== Timberlake headlined the [[Super Bowl LII halftime show]] at [[U.S. Bank Stadium]] in [[Minneapolis]], [[Minnesota]] on February 4, 2018.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/0ap3000000865438/article/justin-timberlake-to-headline-pepsi-super-bowl-lii-halftime-show |title=Justin Timberlake headlines Pepsi Super Bowl LII Halftime Show |date=October 22, 2017 |work=NFL |access-date=October 22, 2017}}</ref> He confirmed via his social media pages that ''Man of the Woods'' will be released on February 2, with a video trailer introducing the album and the influence behind it, "this album is really inspired by my son, my wife, my family, but more so than any album I've ever written–where I'm from."<ref>{{Cite magazine |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8085797/justin-timberlake-new-album-man-of-the-woods-release-date-video |title=Justin Timberlake Announces New Album 'Man of the Woods,' Reveals Release Date |last=Weatherby |first=Taylor |magazine=Billboard|date=January 2, 2018 |accessdate=January 2, 2018}}</ref> The album's [[lead single]], "[[Filthy (song)|Filthy]]" was released on January 5 along with the album pre-order.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/justin-timberlake-announces-new-album-man-of-the-woods/ |title=Justin Timberlake Announces New Album Man of the Woods |last=Yoo |first=Noah |date=January 2, 2018 |work=Pitchfork |access-date=January 2, 2018}}</ref> The song was released with a music video, and three additional videos by different directors were released weekly beginning January 18, with "[[Supplies (song)|Supplies]]" being the first,<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/watch-justin-timberlakes-dystopian-new-supplies-video-w515572 |title=Watch Justin Timberlake's Dystopian New 'Supplies' Video |last=Legaspi |first=Althea |date=January 18, 2018 |work=Rolling Stone |access-date=January 18, 2018}}</ref> followed by the Chris Stapleton-featuring "[[Say Something (Justin Timberlake song)|Say Something]]" and "[[Man of the Woods (song)|Man of the Woods]]". He also performed at the [[2018 Brit Awards]].<ref>{{Cite tweet |number=958248439258624002 |user=jtimberlake |title=Excited to be performing #Brits! See you soon UK. |date=January 30, 2018}}</ref> [[File:Man_of_the_Woods_Tour_-_Miami_-_04.jpg|thumb|right|upright=1.2|Timberlake and the Tennessee Kids on the Man of the Woods tour.]] With the announcement of "Filthy", ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' confirmed guest appearances by Stapleton, [[The Neptunes]] and [[Alicia Keys]] on the album.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/justin-timberlake-to-drop-four-videos-before-man-of-the-woods-album-release-1202652093/ |title=Justin Timberlake to Drop Four Videos Before ‘Man of the Woods’ Album Release |last=Aswad |first=Jem |date=January 3, 2018 |work=Variety |access-date=January 3, 2018}}</ref> The cover art was photographed by [[Ryan McGinley]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://pitchfork.com/news/justin-timberlake-reveals-man-of-the-woods-collaborators-the-neptunes-timbaland-chris-stapleton-more/ |title=Justin Timberlake Reveals Man of the Woods Collaborators: The Neptunes, Timbaland, Chris Stapleton, More |last=Sodomsky |first=Sam |date=January 3, 2018 |work=Pitchfork |access-date=January 3, 2018}}</ref> An exclusive version of the album and its vinyl edition was made available at [[Target Corporation|Target]]; both were made available for presale the day "Filthy" was released.<ref name="BB">{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8085934/justin-timberlake-new-song-filthy-release-date-man-of-the-woods |title=Justin Timberlake to Drop 'Filthy' Single on Jan. 5 |last=Kaufman |first=Gil |date=January 3, 2018 |work=Billboard |access-date=January 3, 2018}}</ref> In February, Timberlake opened a [[Pop-up retail|pop-up shop]] in New York City with limited edition merchandise featuring a total of 16 different brand collaborations, each paired with a song, centered on the concept "country meets streetwear."<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Woolf |first=Jake |date=February 7, 2018 |title=Justin Timberlake, Man of the Woods, Opens a Pop-Up Shop in New York City |url=https://www.gq.com/story/justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods-pop-up-shop-in-new-york-city |magazine=GQ |access-date=April 28, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Maher |first=Natalie |date=February 7, 2018 |title=Justin Timberlake to Open Pop-Up Merch Shop This Weekend in NYC |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8098695/justin-timberlake-pop-up-shop-nyc |magazine=Billboard |access-date=April 28, 2018}}</ref> Since May 2018, the [[Museum of Pop Culture]]'s Holodome exhibits a 360°, immersive reality space presentation by Timberlake performing "Montana", set in Montana by a lake.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.seattletimes.com/entertainment/vulcans-holodome-exhibit-at-mopop-lets-groups-share-an-immersive-reality-experience/ |title=Vulcan's Holodome exhibit at MoPOP lets groups share an 'immersive reality' experience |last=Smith |first=Owen R. |date=May 4, 2018 |work=Seattle Times |access-date=May 18, 2018}}</ref>
"Morning Light", featuring American singer [[Alicia Keys]], was soundtrack of the Brazilian telenovela ''[[O Tempo não Para]]'', exhibited by [[Rede Globo]].
Although not included on the album, Timberlake released the single, "[[SoulMate (Justin Timberlake song)|SoulMate]]" to coincide with the summer leg of ''The Man of the Woods Tour''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://celebmix.com/justin-timberlake-a-year-in-review/|work=CelebMix|date=January 6, 2019|accessdate=January 12, 2019|author=Brittany Sims|title=Justin Timberlake: A Year in Review}}</ref>
==Recording== {{multiple image | align = left | direction = vertical | width = 175 | image1 = Chris Stapleton May 23, 2017.jpg | width1 = 175 | caption1 = [[Chris Stapleton]] is featured on the album's third single "[[Say Something (Justin Timberlake song)|Say Something]]". | link1 = Chris Stapleton | image2 = Alicia Keys cropped.jpg | width2 = 175 | caption2 = [[Alicia Keys]] is featured on the album's eighth song "Morning Light" | link2 = Alicia Keys }} Initial discussions for the album began several years before the production of the album, between Timberlake and [[Pharrell Williams]]. Production was placed on hold for two years, while Timberlake and wife [[Jessica Biel]] had their son, Silas. Production began between Timberlake, Williams and [[Chad Hugo]], with the first song for the album being the title-track, which is the Latin translation of Timberlake's son's name.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hiphop-n-more.com/2018/01/watch-justin-timberlake-full-interview-with-zane-lowe/|title=Watch Justin Timberlake's Full Interview with Zane Lowe – HipHop-N-More|date=January 19, 2018|publisher=}}</ref> Timberlake had not worked with Williams and Hugo (also known as production duo [[The Neptunes]]) after a label dispute with rap group [[Clipse]] during Timberlake's time with [[Jive Records]]. During an interview with [[Beats 1]]'s [[Zane Lowe]], Timberlake said: "It became challenging for him to work with any Jive artist at that point. If I’m being totally honest about it I was extremely hurt being caught up in the middle of it, but at the same time I had a shitload of money stolen, you know, from me by somebody else when I was in [[NSYNC|the group]]. I had already gone through [[NSYNC#1998–99: Breaking the American market and legal battle|legal troubles]], and I kind of felt like, you know what, I’m at this point where I feel like I have so much ahead of me, I just don't want to be in the middle of the record label and somebody that, you know, I consider a friend. And so I feel like I kind of just removed myself from the situation."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/news/pharrell-didnt-work-with-justin-timberlake-for-years-because-he-was-mad-about-clipse-justin-says/|title=Pharrell Didn't Work With Justin Timberlake for Years Because of Clipse Label Problems, Justin Says – Pitchfork|website=pitchfork.com}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hotnewhiphop.com/justin-timberlake-says-label-drama-stopped-him-and-the-neptunes-from-collaborating-news.42418.html|title=Justin Timberlake Says Label Drama Stopped Him & The Neptunes From Collaborating|publisher=}}</ref>
As with ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]'', recording sessions for the album were loose and had multiple studios open for work. In one room, [[Danja (record producer)|Danja]] and [[Timbaland]] worked, Chad Hugo and Pharrell Williams of The Neptunes, worked in another room and producer and member of [[The Y's]], [[Rob Knox (producer)|Rob Knox]] and [[Eric Hudson]] worked in another. A direction was not discussed among the production team too much, as Timberlake already had an idea of the direction he wanted the album to take.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/justin-timberlake-producer-danja-talks-filthy-w515205|title=Justin Timberlake Producer Danja on Making the Wild, Futuristic 'Filthy'|work=Rolling Stone|first=Elias|last=Leight|date=January 9, 2018|accessdate=January 11, 2018}}</ref>
In an interview with ''[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]'', producer Danja spoke of the recording sessions for ''Man of the Woods'', "We didn't have any conversations about the current state of music and that's what we always do. We go in the studio and just do what we feel. This time around, I just feel like he had more of a direction. Like, when we did ''FutureSex/LoveSounds'', we didn't have any conversations of direction or what's going on in the current state of music. We went in and had fun and made music." He also spoke about the vision that Timberlake had for the album: "I remember walking into the studio, and I'm like, 'So, what's the vibe?' He just raised his hands up like, 'This is the vibe.' And what he had on was a [[flannel]], some [[Adidas]], some jeans. He had his beard and a [[knit cap|skully]] on. That was the vibe."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2018/01/danja-interview-justin-timberlake-filthy-man-of-the-woods|title=Producer Danja Explains Why Justin Timberlake's "Filthy" Doesn't Sound Like A Country Song|work=Complex.com|date=January 7, 2018|first=Frazier|last=Tharpe|accessdate=January 11, 2018}}</ref>
Timberlake's wife, Jessica Biel and his son Silas, have uncredited vocals on a number of songs on the album. Biel appears on the album's lead-single "Filthy" and "Hers (Interlude)". When sequencing the album, Timberlake felt that "Filthy" was "a palette-cleanser, then we wanted to take you into the forest, take you outside, so I felt like I needed a voice of consciousness". Timberlake wrote Biel's parts for her, which were subsequently recorded on the Voicenotes [[iPhone]] application. Timberlake wanted her to sound like "the ghost, a presence, but we're following [her]". The "Hers (Interlude)" was recorded after Timberlake mixed the album's eleventh song "Flannel".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rll790aP60Q&t=1219s|title=Justin Timberlake and Zane Lowe on Beats 1 [Part 1]|first=|last=Beats 1 Radio|date=January 18, 2018|publisher=|via=YouTube}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.co.uk/justin-timberlake/news/justin-timberlake-unveils-western-man-of-the-woods-tracklist|title=Justin Timberlake Unveils Western 'Man of the Woods' Tracklist – MTV UK|publisher=}}</ref>
When announcing his [[Man of the Woods Tour]], Timberlake revealed the inspiration for both the album and tour came from the outdoors as well as his family, "The outdoors is the inspiration for a lot of these songs. That's the main idea. The tour will be able to bring the outside in. How can we bring that to life? I want people to see the inspiration for how it ended up sounding. I've never seen that done before: Bring the outside in."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/justin-timberlake-announces-man-of-the-woods-tour-w515129|title=Justin Timberlake Announces Man of the Woods Tour|work=Rolling Stone|last=Kreps|first=Daniel|date=January 8, 2018|accessdate=January 11, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8093180/justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods-north-american-tour|title=Justin Timberlake Announces Man of the Woods North American Tour Dates|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|work=Billboard|date=January 8, 2018|accessdate=January 11, 2018}}</ref>
Chris Stapleton (who is featured on the album's third single "Say Something") was initially only writing songs with Timberlake, before being asked to sing on the song, "I really just went out to [[Los Angeles]] to write songs with him, it's a very fluid process with him, there's a lot going on. That was one of those things where there wasn't necessarily a plan. He was like ‘All right, you hop in there and take a verse,’ and I’m like, ‘You want me to do what?’ ... It came out great. I had a blast with him, he's a great creative force and one of those guys that if you get a chance to work with him, you should.". Stapleton also has writing credits on other songs on the album, including the Alicia Keys-featuring "Morning Light" and "The Hard Stuff" as well as guitar on the lead-single "Filthy".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8096846/chris-stapleton-justin-timberlake-say-something-man-of-the-woods-grammys-interview|title=Chris Stapleton Talks Working With Justin Timberlake on 'Say Something' & His Sneaky Appearance on 'Filthy'|publisher=|accessdate=February 2, 2018}}</ref>
==Music== The genre of the album incorporates traditional [[Rhythm and blues|R&B]] as well as influences from [[Country music|country]] and [[funk]] described as "...[[Americana (music)|Americana]] with [[Roland TR-808|808s]]".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/see-justin-timberlake-tease-new-album-in-behind-the-scenes-doc-w515471|title=Watch Justin Timberlake Tease New Album in Behind-the-Scenes Doc|work=Rolling Stone|last=Blistein|first=Jon|date=January 16, 2018|accessdate=January 17, 2018}}</ref> In a second teaser trailer for the album, Timberlake said that the album has a number of influences. "It's meant to be heard outside even more than inside, I believe. You talk about those, like, Southern guitars and that sound that feels like heritage. That is me exercising my love for where I came from."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/3058933/justin-timberlake-new-album-outdoors/|title=Justin Timberlake Thinks You Should Listen To His New Album Outdoors|last=Holmes|first=Charles|work=MTV|date=January 16, 2018|accessdate=January 17, 2018}}</ref> ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' described most of the album's first half is "cosmopolitan future-funk,"<ref name="rolling stone review"/> while ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' stated the music is funk-soul.<ref name="variety"/>
Ahead of the album release, Timberlake hosted a listening session with music industry insiders and members of the press. [[Associated Press]] commented the album features [[pop music|pop]], R&B and [[electronic music|electronic]] tracks.<ref name="genres">{{Cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/sns-bc-us--music-justin-timberlake-20180117-story.html |title=Timberlake previews album in forest-like space, bugs and all |last=Fekadu |first=Mesfi |date=January 17, 2018 |work=Los Angeles Times |access-date=January 17, 2018}}</ref>
==Critical reception== {{Album ratings | ADM = 4.7/10<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.anydecentmusic.com/review/9114/Justin-Timberlake-Man-Of-The-Woods.aspx |title=Man Of The Woods by Justin Timberlake reviews |work=[[AnyDecentMusic?]] |accessdate=December 18, 2019}}</ref> | MC = 55/100<ref name="Metacritic">{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/music/man-of-the-woods/justin-timberlake |title=Man of the Woods by Justin Timberlake Reviews and Tracks |work=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=February 13, 2018}}</ref> | rev1 = [[AllMusic]] | rev1score = {{Rating|2.5|5}}<ref name="AllMusic">{{cite web |url=https://www.allmusic.com/album/man-of-the-woods-mw0003138633 |title=Man of the Woods – Justin Timberlake |last=Kellman |first=Andy |work=[[AllMusic]] |accessdate=November 21, 2018}}</ref> | rev2 = ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' | rev2score = B−<ref name="AVClub">{{cite web |url=https://www.avclub.com/on-man-of-the-woods-justin-timberlake-offers-up-uneven-1822603715 |title=On Man of the Woods, Justin Timberlake offers up uneven pop pastiches |last=Zaleski |first=Annie |work=[[The A.V. Club]] |date=February 1, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018}}</ref> | rev3 = ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' | rev3score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/music/what-to-listen-to/justin-timberlake-goes-back-nashville-roots-mixed-results-man/ |title=Justin Timberlake goes back to his Nashville roots with mixed results – Man of the Woods, review |last=McCormick |first=Neil |authorlink=Neil McCormick |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |date=February 2, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018}}</ref> | rev4 = ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' | rev4score = B<ref name="Entertainment Weekly">{{cite web |url=http://ew.com/music/2018/01/26/justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods-review/ |title=Justin Timberlake gets (halfway) back to his roots on Man of the Woods: EW review |last=Greenblatt |first=Leah |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=January 26, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018}}</ref> | rev5 = ''[[The Guardian]]'' | rev5score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref name="The Guardian">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2018/jan/28/justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods-review-from-plain-bad-to-bewitching |title=Justin Timberlake: Man of the Woods review – from plain bad to bewitching |last=Petridis |first=Alexis |authorlink=Alexis Petridis |work=[[The Guardian]] |date=January 28, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018}}</ref> | rev6 = ''[[The Independent]]'' | rev6score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref name="The Independent">{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/reviews/justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods-album-review-return-to-roots-soul-pop-a8190396.html |title=Justin Timberlake, Man of the Woods review: A return to his roots |last=Kaplan |first=Ilana |work=[[The Independent]] |date=February 2, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018}}</ref> | rev7 = ''[[NME]]'' | rev7score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref name="NME">{{cite web |url=https://www.nme.com/reviews/justin-timerlake-man-woods-review-2230941 |title=Justin Timberlake – ‘Man Of The Woods’ Review |last=Cooper |first=Leonie |work=[[NME]] |date=January 29, 2018 |accessdate=December 18, 2019}}</ref> | rev8 = ''[[The Observer]]'' | rev8score = {{Rating|2|5}}<ref name="The Observer">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2018/feb/04/justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods-album-review |title=Justin Timberlake: Man of the Woods review – failed fusion of rural rhythms |last=Empire |first=Kitty |authorlink=Kitty Empire |work=[[The Observer]] |date=February 4, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018}}</ref> | rev9 = ''[[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]]'' | rev9score = 3.8/10<ref name="Pitchfork">{{cite web |url=https://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods/ |title=Justin Timberlake: Man of the Woods |last=Cox |first=Jamieson |work=[[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]] |date=February 2, 2018 |accessdate=February 5, 2018}}</ref> | rev10 = ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' | rev10score = {{Rating|3.5|5}}<ref name="rolling stone review">{{cite web |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/justin-timberlakes-man-of-the-woods-album-review-w516240 |title=Review: Justin Timberlake Heads for the Country (Sort of) on ‘Man of the Woods’ |last=Weingarten |first=Christopher R. |work=[[Rolling Stone]] |date=February 2, 2018 |accessdate=February 4, 2018}}</ref> }} ''Man of the Woods'' received mixed reviews from music critics. At [[Metacritic]], which assigns a normalized rating out of 100 to reviews from mainstream critics, the album has an average score of 55 based on 29 reviews, indicating "mixed or average reviews".<ref name="Metacritic"/>
In ''[[Rolling Stone]]'', Christopher R. Weingarten gave the album a positive review, saying "parts of ''Man of the Woods'' are his most exploratory music in years."<ref name="rolling stone review"/> In ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'', Chris Willman expressed "there are plenty of reasons to like ''Man of the Woods'', not least that it's got a good beat and you can dance to it," and concluded "It's the utterly weird boldness of Timberlake figuratively dragging Pharrell and Danja into the middle of a frosty field that makes the album memorable. This is undeniably the real him right now – funkster, family man, firewalker."<ref name="variety">{{Cite news |url=https://variety.com/2018/music/reviews/album-review-justin-timberlake-man-of-the-woods-1202684542/ |title=Album Review: Justin Timberlake’s 'Man of the Woods' |last=Willman |first=Chris |date=February 1, 2018 |work=Variety |access-date=February 2, 2018}}</ref> Jason Lipshutz of ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' summarized his review saying, "''Man of the Woods'' is worth exploring, but it's already worth wondering how Timberlake follows it". ''[[Q (magazine)|Q]]'' said "throughout, ''Man of the Woods'' seesaws brilliantly between pop and country."<ref name="Q magazine">{{cite magazine|magazine=[[Q (magazine)|Q]]|title=Reviews|issue=383|date=April 2018}}</ref> ''Billboard'' included it among the best 50 albums of the first half of 2018.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/list/8459029/best-albums-of-2018-so-far-top-50|title=The 50 Best Albums of 2018 (So Far): Critics' Picks|work=Billboard|date=June 5, 2018|accessdate=June 6, 2018}}</ref>
''Man of the Woods'' received a B from ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'',<ref name="Entertainment Weekly"/> while ''[[The Guardian]]'' and ''[[NME]]'' gave it three out of five stars.<ref name="NME"/> In her review for ''The A.V. Club'', Annie Zaleski said "At its best, this approach leads to sonic whirlwinds."<ref name="AVClub"/> Brock Radke of ''[[Las Vegas Weekly]]'' deemed it Timberlake's "most experimental album" that is "far from a failure, and that's because its bright spots will accomplish the singular goal of all of Timberlake's music: making non-dancing people get up and dance without remorse or self-consciousness." He considered "Higher, Higher" the album's best track, and "Midnight Summer Jam" a "throwback soul party a la [[Earth, Wind & Fire]]."<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://lasvegasweekly.com/ae/music/2018/apr/12/dont-let-justin-timberlakes-odd-new-album-keep-you/|title=Don't let Justin Timberlake's odd new album keep you from dancing through his show|work=Las Vegas Weekly|last=Radke|first=Brock|date=April 12, 2018|accessdate=April 13, 2018}}</ref> In ''[[Exclaim!]]'', Ian Gormely gave the album a 5 out of 10 score, saying that the album is "immaculately produced and performed" but also noting that "sound and feel are no substitute for soul."<ref name="exclaim">{{Cite news |url=https://exclaim.ca/music/article/justin_timberlake-man_of_the_woods |title=Review: Justin Timberlake 'Man of the Woods' |date=February 2, 2018 |work=Exclaim! |accessdate=February 2, 2018}}</ref> Jamieson Cox of ''[[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]]'' rated the album 3.8/10 and called it "a huge misstep for the pop star" as well as "warm, indulgent, inert, and vacuous".<ref name="Pitchfork"/>
==Commercial performance== ''Man of the Woods'' debuted at number one on the US [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] with 293,000 [[album-equivalent unit]]s, of which 242,000 were pure album sales, making it the biggest first week of the year at the time,<ref name="Forbes">{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/hughmcintyre/2018/02/11/justin-timberlakes-man-of-the-woods-opens-at-no-1-with-2018s-biggest-week/#67e863b025ef |title=Justin Timberlake's 'Man of the Woods' Opens at No. 1 With 2018's Biggest Week |publisher=Forbes|date=February 11, 2018}}</ref> and gave Timberlake his fourth consecutive number-one album in the country.<ref name="Billboard MOTW">{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8099090/justin-timberlake-earns-fourth-no-1-album-on-billboard-200-chart|title=Justin Timberlake Earns Fourth No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 Chart With 'Man of the Woods'|work=Billboard|last=Caulfield|first=Keith|date=February 11, 2018|accessdate=February 12, 2018}}</ref> It is also his fourth album to top the [[Canadian Albums Chart]], opening at the country's summit with 18,000 consumption units.<ref>{{cite web|title=Justin Timberlake Takes The Top and the Sheepdogs Surge|url=http://www.fyimusicnews.ca/articles/2018/02/12/justin-timberlake-takes-top-and-sheepdogs-surge|publisher=FYI Music News|date=February 12, 2018|accessdate=February 12, 2018}}</ref>
During its second chart week, ''Man of the Woods'' dropped one spot to number two on the ''Billboard'' 200, selling 74,000 total units.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8205904/black-panther-album-billboard-200-chart-no-1|title='Black Panther: The Album' Debuts at No. 1 on Billboard 200 Chart|work=Billboard|last=Caulfield|first=Keith|date=February 18, 2018|accessdate=February 22, 2018}}</ref> In its third chart week, the album remained in the top ten of the ''Billboard'' 200, charting at number six and selling 38,000 total units.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8219136/black-panther-album-billboard-200-no-1-second-week|title='Black Panther: The Album' remains at No. 1 on Billboard 200 Chart |work=Billboard |last=Caulfield |first=Keith |date=February 18, 2018 |accessdate=February 22, 2018}}</ref> It fell out of the top ten to number eleven, selling 28,000 total units in its fourth chart week.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8230391/bon-jovis-back-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-albums-chart|title='Black Panther: The Album' falls to No. 2 on Billboard 200 Chart |work=Billboard |last=Caulfield |first=Keith |date=February 18, 2018 |accessdate=March 6, 2018}}</ref>
In March 2018, ''Man of the Woods'' was certified [[Music recording sales certification|Gold]] by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA) for sales of over 500,000 album-equivalent units in the US.<ref name="riaa"/>
In 2018, ''Man of the Woods'' was ranked as the 46th most popular album of the year on the ''Billboard'' 200.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/year-end/2018/top-billboard-200-albums|title=Billboard 2018 Year End Charts|website=Billboard}}</ref> Timberlake was named [[Amazon Prime]]'s most streamed artist of the year,<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.amazon.com/b/ref=dmm_sm_tw_18424185011_120418?node=18424185011&ref=tsm_1_tw_s__1953014009&linkId=60550579 |title=Best of Prime 2018 |date=December 4, 2018 |work=Amazon |accessdate=December 4, 2018}}</ref> as well as the 24th top artist of the year by ''Billboard''.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/year-end/2018/top-artists|title=Billboard 2018 Year End Charts|website=Billboard}}</ref> ''Man of the Woods'' concluded 2018 as the sixth best-selling album of the year and the 31st most consumed album of the year overall.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Caulfield |first1=Keith |title=Drake's 'Scorpion' Is Nielsen Music's Top Album Of 2018 in U.S., 'God's Plan' Most-Streamed Song |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8492663/nielsen-music-top-album-2018-drake-scorpion |publisher=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |accessdate=January 14, 2019 |date=January 8, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= http://hitsdailydouble.com/news&id=314588&title=2018-TOP-50-ALBUMS&title=YEAR-TO-c-ALBUMS|title=Top 50 Albums of 2018|website=HITS}}</ref>
As of January 2019, ''Man of the Woods'' has sold over 774,000 album-equivalent units in the US, with over 422,000 being pure sales.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://hitsdailydouble.com/news&id=314588&title=2018-TOP-50-ALBUMS&title=YEAR-TO-c-ALBUMS|title=Top 50 Albums of 2018|website=HITS}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Caulfield |first1=Keith |title=Drake's 'Scorpion' Is Nielsen Music's Top Album Of 2018 in U.S., 'God's Plan' Most-Streamed Song |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8492663/nielsen-music-top-album-2018-drake-scorpion |publisher=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |accessdate=January 14, 2019 |date=January 8, 2019}}</ref>

===Sample credits=== * "Sauce" contains a sample from "Juice vs. Sauce" by GinoRuss. * "Livin' Off the Land" contains an audio sample from the TV show ''[[Mountain Men (TV series)|Mountain Men]]''. * "Young Man" contains a sample from "La La Eh" from Ashley & Bobby's album ''It's a Beautiful Day To Play''.
==Personnel== Credits are adapted from album’s [[liner notes]].<ref>{{cite AV media notes|title= Man of the Woods |year= 2018 |type= booklet |publisher= [[RCA Records|RCA]]}}</ref>
*[[Justin Timberlake]] - lead and background vocals, guitars (4, 9, 11, 12, 14), additional keyboards (5), instruments (10), harmonium (11) *Rhea Dummett - additional vocals (13) *[[J-Roc|Jerome “J-Roc” Harmon]] - keyboards (16) *[[Eric Hudson]] - keyboards (8, 15), bass (8) *[[Chad Hugo]] - clavinet (2), [[Moog synthesizer|Moog]] (4, 5, 12), organ (5), accordion (11), synthesizers (13) *Elliott Ives - guitars (1-9, 11-16), harmonica (2), ukulele (6) *[[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]] - keyboards (1) *Peter Lee Johnson - strings (2, 8, 10, 15) *[[Alicia Keys]] - vocals (8) *Mike Larson - Moog programming (12), synth programming (13) *[[Raphael Saadiq]] - bass and electric guitar (6) *[[Chris Stapleton]] - guitars (8, 9, 15), vocals (9) *[[Jessica Biel|Jessica Timberlake]] - additional vocals (1, 2, 11, 16), narration (10) *Silas Timberlake - additional vocals (16) *[[Pharrell Williams]] - additional vocals (2, 6, 7)
==Production== * Executive Music Producer: [[Justin Timberlake]] * Produced by Justin Timberlake (1, 3, 8-10, 15, 16), [[Timbaland]] (1, 9, 16), [[Danja (record producer)|Danja]] (1, 3, 9), [[The Neptunes]] ([[Pharrell Williams]] & [[Chad Hugo]]) (2, 4-7, 11-14), [[Rob Knox (producer)|Rob Knox]] (8, 15), [[J-Roc|Jerome “J-Roc” Harmon]] (16) ** Additional Production by Justin Timberlake (2, 4-7, 11-14), Elliott Ives (3), [[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]] (9) ** Co-Produced by [[Eric Hudson]] (8) * All Vocals Produced and Arranged by Justin Timberlake * Engineered by Chris Godbey (1, 3, 9, 10, 16), Andrew Coleman & Mike Larson (2, 4-7, 11-14), Ben Chang (8, 15) ** Assisted by Ben Sedano (1, 2, 4-9, 11-16), Jon Sher (2, 4, 6, 7, 11-16), Eric Eylands (2, 4, 11, 14), John Armstrong (2, 5, 12), Tyler Shields (2, 6), Jeremy Miller (2, 6), Sean Klein (3, 10), Funai Costa (5), Martin Giraldo (5), Joshua Harris (5, 12) * Mixed by Chris Godbey at Jungle City Studios, NYC ** Assisted by Sean Klein * Mastered by Dave Kutch at The Mastering Palace, NYC *A&R: Andre “Dre” Person *Management: Rick Yorn and Josh Dembling at LBI Entertainment, and Johnny Wright at Wright Entertainment Group *Personal Assistant to Mr. Timberlake: Veronica Pinto *Brand Visibility: Louis Muckle and Sonia Muckle at M2M Construction LLC *Business Management: Michael S. Dreyer at Dreyer, Robbins & Associates *Digital Team: Brad Margolis, Rachael Yarbrough, Faith-Ann Young *Legal Representation: David Lande, Alicia Winfield Sydney, Mitch Tenzer and Kelly Vallon at Ziffren Brittenhaum LLP *Creative Direction: Trace Ayala & David Cho *Photography: Ryan McGinley *Art Direction & Design: GrandArmy *Groomer: Christine Nelli *Stylist: Annie Psaltaris *Stylist Assistant: Dolly Pratt
